name: Edamam Food and Grocery Database
description:
This API provides you with tools to find nutrition and diet data for generic foods, packaged foods and restaurant meals. In addition it employs NLP (Natural Language Processing) which allows for extraction of food entities from unstructured text.   

Covered Use Cases: 
    -Search for a food by keyword, food name or UPC/Barcode 
    -Sourcing of nutrition facts for a given food, including: macro and micro nutrients, allergen labels, lifestyle and health labels 
    -Search for a food by give...

api_methods.name: /api/food-database/v2/nutrients
api_methods.description: In the response to your parser request you receive the a food ID for each database match. Using the food ID and the measure URI, which parser provides, you can make a request to the nutrients access point. The nutrients access points returns nutrition with diet and health labels for a given quantity of the food. Access Point: https://api.edamam.com/api/food-database/v2/nutrients

utterances.utterance: Can you provide the nutritional information for a specific food item?
I need to know the diet and health labels for a meal I had.
What are the macro and micro nutrients in the food I just scanned?
Tell me the allergen labels for the packaged food I bought.
Could you give me the nutrition facts for a restaurant meal?
I want to check the lifestyle labels for a food item.
Please find the health labels for the groceries I purchased.
What are the nutritional details of the food I entered?
Can you show me the diet labels for a specific dish?
I need the nutrition information for a food product I have.

api_methods.name: /api/food-database/v2/parser
api_methods.description:
The parser access point handles text search for foods as well as filters for the foods like presence specific nutrient content or exclusion of allergens.
  • Search for a phrase or keyword using NLP to get food entities from it.
  • Get basic nutrition facts and ingredients for each food
  • Search for food by given nutrient quantity for 28 nutrients
  • Search for foods within a given brand
  • With the build in food-logging context it allows for requests which do not contain quantity and suggest expected quantities for them.
Access Point: https://api.edamam.com/api/food-database/v2/parser

parameters.name: nutrients[WATER]
parameters.description:
Water. Unit: g. Input the range which is one of MIN+, MIN-MAX or MAX, where MIN and MAX are non-negative floating point numbers.

See calcium for an example for how to fill in the range.

parameters.description:

See calcium for an example for how to fill in the range.

parameters.name: ingr
parameters.description: A keyword search parameter to be found in the food name. REQUIRED if 'upc' and 'brand' are not specified. NOT REQUIRED if 'brand' is specified. DO NOT POPULATE if 'upc' is specified.

parameters.name: nutrition-type
parameters.description: Select between cooking and food logging processor.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Categories

parameters.name: nutrients[FATRN]
parameters.description:
Fatty acids, total trans. Unit: g. Input the range which is one of MIN+, MIN-MAX or MAX, where MIN and MAX are non-negative floating point numbers.

See calcium for an example for how to fill in the range.

parameters.name: calories
parameters.description: The format is calories=RANGE where RANGE is replaced by the value in kcal. RANGE is in one of MIN+, MIN-MAX or MAX, where MIN and MAX are non-negative integer numbers. The + symbol needs to be properly encoded. Examples: “calories=100-300” will return all recipes with which have between 100 and 300 kcal per serving.

parameters.name: upc
parameters.description: Valid UPC, EAN, or PLU code. REQUIRED if neither 'ingr' nor 'brand' are specified. DO NOT POPULATE otherwise.

parameters.name: nutrients[VITB6A]
parameters.description:
Vitamin B6. Unit: mg. Input the range which is one of MIN+, MIN-MAX or MAX, where MIN and MAX are non-negative floating point numbers.

See calcium for an example for how to fill in the range.

parameters.name: nutrients[ENERC_KCAL]
parameters.description:

See calcium for an example for how to fill in the range.

parameters.name: nutrients[FASAT]
parameters.description:
Fatty acids, total saturated. Unit: g. Input the range which is one of MIN+, MIN-MAX or MAX, where MIN and MAX are non-negative floating point numbers.

parameters.name: nutrients[NA]
parameters.description:
Sodium, Na. Unit: mg. Input the range which is one of MIN+, MIN-MAX or MAX, where MIN and MAX are non-negative floating point numbers.

parameters.name: nutrients[P]
parameters.description:

See calcium for an example for how to fill in the range.

parameters.name: nutrients[FAPU]
parameters.description:
Fatty acids, total polyunsaturated. Unit: g. Input the range which is one of MIN+, MIN-MAX or MAX, where MIN and MAX are non-negative floating point numbers.

See calcium for an example for how to fill in the range.

parameters.name: nutrients[CA]
parameters.description:
Calcium, Ca. Unit: mg. Input the range which is one of MIN+, MIN-MAX or MAX, where MIN and MAX are non-negative floating point numbers.

For example: nutrients[CA]=50+ means minimum 50mg calcium, where ‘50+’ has to be properly encoded as ‘50%2B’ nutrients[FAT]=30 means maximum 30g fat and nutrients[FE]=5-10 means iron between 5mg and 10mg inclusive

parameters.name: nutrients[VITB12]
parameters.description:

See calcium for an example for how to fill in the range.

utterances.utterance: Can you find nutrition details for a banana?
Show me foods with less than 5g of added sugars.
I'm looking for foods high in vitamin C, at least 50mg.

api_methods.name: /auto-complete
api_methods.description: Edamam provides a convenient autocomplete functionality which can be implemented for use when searching for ingredients. Just send in the current query as the "q" parameter and the number of suggestions you wish to receive as the "limit" parameter. Access Point: https://api.edamam.com/auto-complete

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query text. For example q=chi. This or the r parameter are required

constraints.inter-dependency: q, r: This or the r parameter are required.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: response limit

utterances.utterance: Can you suggest some foods that start with 'chi'?
I'm looking for ingredients that begin with 'broc'. Show me up to 5 suggestions.
What are some foods that start with 'alm'?
Give me a list of foods starting with 'quinoa'. Limit the results to 3.
Find ingredients that start with 'turm'.
Can you autocomplete foods starting with 'spinach'? I need 10 suggestions.
Show me foods that begin with 'avoc'.
I'm searching for ingredients starting with 'cinn'. Limit the results to 7.
What foods can you find that start with 'kale'?
List some foods starting with 'ginger'. I want 4 suggestions.

api_methods.name: /api/food-database/v2/nutrients
api_methods.description: In the response to your parser request you receive the a food ID for each database match. Using the food ID and the measure URI, which parser provides, you can make a request to the nutrients access point. The nutrients access points returns nutrition with diet and health labels for a given quantity of the food. Access Point: https://api.edamam.com/api/food-database/v2/nutrients
